See more recent news In Canada, Tim Hortons aims to eat McDonald’s lunch Penny Stock DD 2 hrs ago Comment TORONTO (Reuters) - Tim Hortons Inc interim Chief Executive Paul House is pushing for more of Canada's lunch market, and sees the Canadian chain, best known for its coffee, overtaking McDonald's Corp in lunchtime market share within about... In Canada, Tim Hortons aims to eat McDonald's lunch Reuters 4 hrs ago Comment Tim Hortons Inc interim Chief Executive Paul House is pushing for more of Canada's lunch market, and sees the Canadian chain, best known for its coffee, overtaking McDonald's Corp in lunchtime market share within about five years. Tim Hortons adding free Wi-Fi Canada.com Jul 5 Comment It might not take you 20 minutes to eat that timbit, but now you can stick around longer than that while you surf the web Tim Hortons adding free Bell Wi-Fi Canada.com Jul 5 Comment Tim Hortons pours a hot cup of free WiFi for 2,000 stores The Globe and Mail Jul 5 Comment Wireless Internet access to be offered, similar to services from McDonald’s, Second Cup and Starbucks Tim Hortons offers free wireless internet CBC.ca Jul 5 Comment Tim Hortons is joining the ranks of restaurants offering a digital perk to its coffee-mad customers — free wireless internet. Fast-food dividend stock fight: McDonald's vs. Tim Hortons The Globe and Mail May 29 Comment Weigh up this comparison before placing an order Tim Hortons Inc. to present at Goldman Sachs Lodging, Gaming, Restaurant and Leisure Conference PR Newswire May 29 Comment OAKVILLE, ON, May 29, 2012 /PRNewswire/ - Tim Hortons Inc. (TSX: THI, NYSE: THI) announced today that management will be participating in the Goldman Sachs Lodging, Gaming, Restaurant and Leisure Conference in New York, New York on Tuesday, June Tim Hortons Goes Ex-Dividend Soon Forbes May 21 Comment On 5/22/12, Tim Hortons, Inc. (Toronto: THI) will trade ex-dividend, for its quarterly dividend of $0.21, payable on 6/8/12. As a percentage of THI's recent stock price of $53.71, this dividend works out to approximately 0.39%. Click here to find... Tim Hortons Inc. to present at Morgan Stanley Retail&Restaurant Conference PR Newswire May 18 Comment OAKVILLE, ON, May 18, 2012 /PRNewswire/ - Tim Hortons Inc. (TSX: THI, NYSE: THI) announced today that management will be participating in the Morgan Stanley Retail Conference in Boston, MA on Wednesday, May 23(rd), 2012 at 1:45 p.m. EDST. A live Tim Hortons now accepts Visa Canada.com May 15 Comment Canadians can now pay for their Tim Hortons coffee and doughnuts with Visa credit cards, the coffee company announced Tuesday Oops! Starbucks (SBUX) Commodities NYSE Euronext (NYX) Oil Wheat more▼ Discussion History Bookmark Print WIKI ANALYSIS TOP CONTRIBUTORS Alexander Nicolau Thomas Shyr Tim Hortons, Inc. ( NYSE :THI) is the largest fast food restaurant chain in Canada (and the fourth-largest in all of North America) based on market capitalization. [1] Its best selling product is coffee, and the chain is known for its "double-double," a coffee with two creams and two sugars. Tim Horton's also has a food menu to complement its beverage selection, offering doughnuts, sandwiches, and other food items.
Despite intense competition throughout Canada coming from other fast food giants such as McDonald's , Tim Horton’s has acquired more than 75% share of customer traffic in Canada’s coffee and baked goods sector. The company views Quebec and Western Canada as its fastest-growing domestic markets and as opportunities for further expansion. Tim Horton's has also been eager to expand U.S. operations, since it already has high market saturation in Canada. This is problematic, as it is forced to compete with entrenched brands like Dunkin' Donuts, McDonald's (MCD) , and Starbucks , and it hasn’t been that successful in the U.S. markets.
Another issue that the company confronts rising prices for commodities such as coffee, oil , wheat , and sugar, which have compressed margins. Tim Horton's must keep its products affordable to attract customers, which keeps it from passing these costs directly onto consumers.
